page.title: 11DERBY SCANNER APPEAL
page.content: The{body scanner}was delivered to Derbyshire Royal Infirmary in March 1985 and the first person was scanned the following month. A target of 600 000 pounds was launched in March of the previous year by the Duke of Devonshire who is president of the Derby Scanner Appeal Committee. Derby High School contributed 1000 pounds through a project during Lent which included raffles, games, sponsorships and competitions. Money was raised by many other groups in a variety of ways e.g. dances, concerts, coffee mornings and jumble sales. The body scanner is used for patients who are seriously ill or after accidents. It is a quick and painless way of examining the body in thirty minutes, replacing surgery and other painful techniques. Many people in our community will benefit as it speeds up medical treatment.
